newsitem.title: USA: Northwest cites April cargo traffic gains.
newsitem.headline: Northwest cites April cargo traffic gains.

text.p: Northwest Airlines said April cargo traffic rose 1.4 percent on the strength of a 2.9 percent gain in international cargo ton miles (CTMS).
Total April CTMs were 176.4 million, up from 174 million in April 1996.
The carrier said international CTMs were 108.6 million, up from 105.6 million a year ago, while domestic CTMs declined 9 percent to 67.5 million.
Through four months of 1997, total system CTMs are up 1.2 percent thanks to a 1.8 percent rise in international traffic. -- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+in5017
